definition: lit. to mend the pen after sheep are lost (idiom)/fig. to act belatedly/better late than never/to lock the stable door after the horse has bolted
old variant of 亡[wang2]
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased
surname Yang
sheep/goat/CL:頭|头[tou2],隻|只[zhi1]
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
firm/sturdy/fold (for animals)/sacrifice/prison

sentences.english: Rulers in Beijing are belatedly trying to befriend his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 北京的统治者们才亡羊补牢的费心思去亲近他的敌人。

sentences.english: Its nevr too late to mend.
Never too old to learn, never too late to turn.
sentences.chinese: 活到老学到老，亡羊补牢为时未晚。

sentences.english: The so-called transposition thinking, but a better mode.
sentences.chinese: 所谓换位思考，不过是一个亡羊补牢式的方式。

sentences.english: But it is not too late.
sentences.chinese: 好在，亡羊补牢，犹未晚也。

sentences.english: You really should break the habit of reading your horoscope every day, before it's too late.
sentences.chinese: 你得改掉这个每天都算命的习惯，亡羊补牢为时未晚。

sentences.english: It is never to late to mend.
Realize that it's never too late.
sentences.chinese: 认识到“亡羊补牢，尤未为晚”。

sentences.english: Go to the police and tell what you have done. You should know the importance of locking the barn door after the horse was stolen.
sentences.chinese: 到警察局去自首，你应该知道亡羊补牢的重要性。

sentences.english: It's not too late to mend.
Go to police station for cop-out, you should know the importance of repentance.
sentences.chinese: 到警察局去自首，你应该知道亡羊补牢的重要性。

sentences.english: It is never too late to mend.
The idiom "Mend the fold after a sheep is lost" comes from Zhuang Xin's answer to the king.
sentences.chinese: 成语“亡羊补牢”就是由庄辛对楚王的回答而来。

sentences.english: The idiom "Mend the fold after a sheep is lost" has developed from Zhuang Xin's answer to the king.
sentences.chinese: 成语“亡羊补牢”就是由庄辛对楚王的回答而来的。

sentences.english: For those people who often break their promises, the only thing they can do is to take precautions after suffering a loss.
sentences.chinese: 对于常常食言的人来说，唯一能做的就是亡羊补牢了。

definition: it is not too late (idiom)
it is not too late (idiom)
it is not too late (idiom)
to remedy
to prevent troubles before the event (idiom)/to forestall/to nip sth in the bud
see 防患未然[fang2 huan4 wei4 ran2]
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to nip in the bud (idiom)
lit. not to dig a well until one is thirsty/to be unprepared and seek help at the last minute (idiom)
to think of the pain when the pain is gone (idiom)/to ponder about a painful experience
already too late
to draw a lesson (from a setback)
too late for regrets (idiom); It is useless to repent after the event.
unhelpful/useless
lit. the cart in front overturns, a warning to the following cart (idiom); fig. draw lesson from the failure of one's predecessor/learn from past mistake/once bitten twice shy
pinyin: qian2 che1 zhi1 fu4 , hou4 che1 zhi1 jian4
